title: General
custom_preconds:
**Cases should be run on both Handset and Tablet**

Audio feeds - Come from this data file (http://gd.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/year_2011/month_02/day_04/mobile_epg.xml) substitute date and year

Feeds must have 'state' of "audio_on"

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify UI when no games have live audio
custom_steps_separated.expected:
User should not see any audio feeds in player
User should see error message that says "No feeds/games currently available"

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify UI when games have live audio
custom_steps_separated.expected: User should see <Away Team> @ <Home Team> and the game time or inning status

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify audio UI updates as games progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: User should see game status changes and inning status changes reflected in the UI

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects an audio stream from the list of available games
(And the user does not have a favorite team set)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Home team audio feed should begin playing by default

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects an audio stream from the list of available games
(And the user has a favorite team set that is the Away team in the selected matchup)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the audio feed for the favorite team should begin playing by default
despite the fact that they are the away team

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects an audio stream from the list of available games
and the game is being played at one of the 30 MLB ballparks
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the home team's ballpark image should appear as the background of the audio screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user selects an audio stream from the list of available games
and the game is being played at a non-MLB ballpark
(Spring Training/Exhibition games)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a generic ballpark image will appear as the background of the audio screen

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify playing status is reflected when user selects stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The selected audio feed should begin to play
And the playing status should be updated in the Audio Status window

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there are multiple feeds for a single game
And the user taps on the different feeds (Home - English | Away - English | Home - Spanish | Away - Spanish)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then each Audio feed should begin to play when selected
And if a previous feed was playing, it should stop

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Stop button
(While a stream is playing)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the audio stream should stop
And the audio status should be reflected correctly in the status window
And the Stop button should turn into a Play button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Play button immediately after tapping the Stop button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the audio stream should begin to play again
And the stream status should be reflected correctly in the status window
And the Play button should turn into a Stop button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps between audio streams for multiple games
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the previously selected stream cell should not appear selected
And the newly selected stream cell should appear depressed
And the newly selected stream/feed will show that it's playing in the status window
And the newly selected stream will display the correct audio feeds for the game selected
And the newly selected stream will display the correct playing state

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user begins scrolling down the Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the top "Audio" text, back arrow, and the game feed controls will disappear

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user begins scrolling down the Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then only the following should remain available:
game matchup text
stream status
selected feed
Play/Stop button

custom_steps_separated.content:
User rotates device from Portrait to Landscape and vice versa
(Handset only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the screen and Audio UI should remain locked in Portrait

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there are streams from multiple game types available (Regular season, Spring Training, Exhibition)
Verify Audio streams follow sorting rules for games
(Assumes user does not have favorite team)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio streams will be sorted according to the following order.

Regular season --> Spring Training --> Exhibition

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the device is set to Spanish
and a game has Spanish language audio feeds available
and the user attempts to start a game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Spanish language feed should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game has ONLY spanish language audio feeds
And the user attempts to start a game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Spanish language feed should begin to play
(Test as an English Language user and a Spanish Language user)

**Case should only occur during spring training**

title: Entry Points
custom_preconds:
Cases separated for Handset [H] and Tablet [T]
Cases are for Full At Bat users unless otherwise indicated

custom_steps_separated.content:
[H] When the user is on the Scoreboard
When user taps to expand a game cell for a game that has an active audio stream
And taps on the Audio icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
And the Stream for the Home Team should begin to play
(Assuming the user does not have the Away team set as their favorite team)

custom_steps_separated.content:
[H] When the user taps on the Audio icon in the Nav Bar from any section that has it:
News
Scoreboard
Standings
Teams (And Team pages)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI

custom_steps_separated.content:
[H] When the user is on a team page
When the user taps on the Audio icon in the main view for a team that has an active audio stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
And the Audio stream for that particular game should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content: [T] When the user taps on the Audio icon in the Nav Bar from any section of the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Audio UI should launch as a pop-up

custom_steps_separated.content: Lite user: Attempts to launch Audio player or Access Audio Feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be prompted with the Pay Wall

custom_steps_separated.content:
Lite user: Logs in to entitled account after getting blocked from accessing Audio UI
And the user attempts to launch the Audio UI again
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
And the user should be able to launch an audio stream

title: Streaming Tests
custom_preconds:
Cases should be run on Handset and Tablet.
(Note: Some cases can only be run on Handset. Those involving text messages for example)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user starts up an audio stream
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the audio should be able to run for at least 10 minutes without issues or interruptions

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can play audio over each carrier
custom_steps_separated.expected: Audio should play uninterrupted over carrier

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can play audio over WiFi connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Audio should play uninterrupted over WiFi

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can play audio over 4G connection (LTE or HSPA+)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Audio should play uninterrupted

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can play audio over 3G connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Audio should play uninterrupted

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user roams from WiFi to Carrier connection and vice versa while playing audio
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio stream should continue to play
(Note: it may buffer momentarily before continuing to play)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is streaming Audio
And the user taps the "Home" button or "Back" button to send At Bat to the background
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Audio should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is streaming Audio
and the user locks the device screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio should continue to play
(test for an extended period of time)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is streaming Audio 
and plugs earphones into the device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio should continue to play without issue
and there should be no interruption in playback

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user receives phone call while audio is playing
And the user answers the phone call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio stream should pause
And the Audio stream should resume once the user hangs up the phone

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user receives a phone call while audio is playing
And the user ignores the phone call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio stream should briefly pause while the ringtone is played or the user is prompted to answer the phone
And after the user has ignored the phone call the stream should resume

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is streaming Audio over CARRIER network
And the user receives a text message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be able to hear the notification tone
And the audio should continue to play normally
And the user should be able to receive and view the text message

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is streaming Audio 
And the user receives an Email or another notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be able to hear the notification tone
And the audio should continue to play normally
And the user should be able to view the notification or content.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is streaming Audio
And the user sets an alarm to go off
When the alarm goes off
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio stream should pause
And the alarm sound should be audible 
And the user should be able to dismiss or snooze the alarm

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is streaming Audio, Stops it, then backgrounds the app
And the user receives any sort of notification from another app (Gmail, Messages, etc)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the notification sound should be audible
And the Audio should NOT start playing again

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user launches a Gameday Audio stream
"Stop" the feed
Taps "Play" to start listening to the feed again
and then launches any other sort of audio either within the app (video) or from another app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Audio stream should pause
and the new audio should start to play

custom_steps_separated.content: When user starts Audio stream
custom_steps_separated.expected: Persistent notification should appear and it should remain until the stream is stopped

custom_steps_separated.content: When user stops Audio stream
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the notification should disappear

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user pulls down the notification shade
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the notification should display the following:
stream status
the Station call-sign for the feed that is playing
the game matchup text (away @ home)
the game matchup team logos (away, home)
a Play/Stop button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user pulls down the notification shade
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the notification should display the following playing states:
Connecting
Buffering
Now Playing
Reconnecting
Network error

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user loses connectivity 
And the stream stops
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the notification should dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a stream is playing
and the user taps the Stop button on the notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream will be stopped
and the notification will be dismissed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has At Bat open
And the user taps on the ongoing Audio notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be brought to the Audio UI on Handsets
or the user should see the Audio UI drop down on Tablets

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has At Bat in the background
And the user taps on the ongoing Audio notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be brought into At Bat and dropped in the Audio UI on handsets
or the user should be brought into At Bat and the Audio UI should appear in a dropped down state on Tablets

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user tries to swipe away or clear the ongoing Audio notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the notification should persist 
And the user should not be able to dismiss the notification while the Audio Stream is playing

title: Post-Game Audio
custom_steps: When a game has gone to final
custom_expected:
Then media_state will determine if the audio link should remain available on the EPG & Scoreboard
and NOT game_state

custom_steps_separated.content: on the Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then audio streams for that game should remain available on the EPG until the post-game show ends

custom_steps_separated.content: on the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Audio button should be available from the expanded game cell until the post-game show ends

custom_steps_separated.content: on the Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Audio button should NOT appear on the top team page schedule

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is listening to an audio stream on a WIFI connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Gameday audio stream will play and when there's a break in the action, the midroll will play and then return you back to the Gameday audio stream

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is listening to an audio stream on a cellular connection 

Test on the following: Verizon, AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Gameday audio stream will play and when there's a break in the action, the midroll will play and then return you back to the Gameday audio stream

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is listening to a Gameday audio stream and the audio midroll is playing and the user switches to another audio feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should only hear the newly selected feed playing
and the audio midroll should not continue playing

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is listening to a Gameday audio stream and the audio midroll is playing and backgrounds the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the audio midroll will continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is listening to a Gameday audio stream and the audio midroll is playing and taps on a video
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the audio midroll is paused and the audio for the video will begin to play and once the video is done the audio midroll (or Gameday audio) will begin to play again

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is listening to a Gameday audio stream and the audio midroll is playing and the device alarm goes off
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the At Bat app or audio feed should not crash

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is listening to a Gameday audio stream and the audio midroll is playing and the device receives a call or text message
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the At Bat app or audio feed should not crash

custom_steps_separated.content: When a dev has configured the audio midroll kill switch to on and the user is listening to Gameday audio
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then no audio midroll will be played

title: Scoreboard
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed on an Android handset
and is logged in with a Single Team account
custom_steps: When the user navs to the Scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has no favorite team set
and taps to expand a game cell for a game that their Single Team is playing and is the Home Team
and that has an active audio stream
and taps on the Audio button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has their Single Team set as a favorite team
and taps to expand a game cell for a game that their Single Team is playing and is the Home Team
and that has an active audio stream
and taps on the Audio button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has the opposing team set as a favorite team
and taps to expand a game cell for a game that their Single Team is playing and is the Home Team
and that has an active audio stream
and taps on the Audio button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has no favorite team set
and taps to expand a game cell for a game that their Single Team is playing and is the Away Team
and that has an active audio stream
and taps on the Audio button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has their Single Team set as a favorite team
and taps to expand a game cell for a game that their Single Team is playing and is the Away Team
and that has an active audio stream
and taps on the Audio button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has the opposing team set as a favorite team
and taps to expand a game cell for a game that their Single Team is playing and is the Away Team
and that has an active audio stream
and taps on the Audio button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

title: Team Page
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed on an Android handset
and is logged in with a Single Team account
custom_steps: When the user navs to a Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has no favorite team set
and navs to their Single Team's team page when there are active audio streams
and the Single Team is the Home Team
and taps on the Audio button on the score module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has no favorite team set
and navs to the opposing team's team page when there are active audio streams
and the Single Team is the Home Team
and taps on the Audio button on the score module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has their Single Team set as a favorite team
and navs to their Single Team's team page when the team has an active audio stream
and the Single Team is the Home Team

Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI

and taps on the Audio button on the score module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI
and the Stream for the Single Team should begin to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has their Single Team set as a favorite team
and navs to their Single Team's team page when the team has an active audio stream
and the Single Team is the Away Team
and taps on the Audio button on the score module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to the Audio UI

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has their Single Team set as a favorite team
